channel.title: Kw’s Blog
channel.description: A blog about everything and nothing.

item.title: New Year’s Python Meme 2013/2014
item.description: Via Tarek Zi­adé (o­rig­i­nal meme, none this year…) and Alex Clark. Right af­ter the break.

item.title: Managing Tasks, Chris’ Way
item.description: Time man­age­ment is hard. The best way to do it is to have a task list, al­so known as a to-­do list. And the best tool? Pen and pa­per. Yes, ana­log pen and ana­log pa­per.

item.title: Adventures in Windows: Music Player Daemon
item.description:
Re­cent­ly, I had to re­in­stall Win­dows. One of the things I had to set up­ was MPD, the Mu­sic Play­er Dae­mon.

This is a short guide on how to do this.

item.title: Password Changing 101
item.description: Yes­ter­day, I fi­nal­ly cre­at­ed a new pass­word for my­self. Now, chang­ing ­pass­words all over the world is what I should do. But it is­n’t easy.

item.title: Nikola — The Best Blog Engine Ever!
item.description: I re­cent­ly found out about Niko­la (through Plan­et Python). It is awe­some, even bet­ter than Hyde. Why? Right af­ter the break.

item.title: New Year’s Python Meme 2012
item.description: Via Tarek Zi­adé. Right af­ter the break.

item.title: Forty Million is Nothing!
item.description: I’ve been busy, but I now have time to write about it: in a bit over one mon­th, Mi­crosoft sold 40,000,000 li­cens­es of Mi­cro­soft Win­dows. That is a lit­tle bit above, hm­m, noth­ing.

item.title: Sinofsky out
item.description:
Steven Sinof­sky said good­bye to Mi­cro­soft on Mon­day. Who is he, ­may you ask? The guy that pro­vid­ed us with en­ter­tain­ment for the last few months here. He was re­spon­si­ble for cre­at­ing this beau­ti­ful piece of shit that is Win­dows 8. So, he fucked shit up and quit. ­Mar­vel­lous.

So, bye Steve, and have fun fuck­ing shit up some­where else. May­be Scheißung, um, Sam­sung?

item.title: Windows 8 Commentary
item.description: Win­dows 8 was re­leased on 2012-10-26. That is, 16 days ago. Why am I writ­ing about it now? Easy: be­cause I did not even both­er do­ing a re­view. This is just a bit of quick com­men­tary.

item.title: PKGBUILDer Ready for Prime Time!
item.description: Yes­ter­day, I of­fi­cial­ly de­cid­ed to get PKG­BUILDer a life.
